intro: Clerodendrum lupakense, commonly known as the Malabar flame-of-the-forest, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a dramatic visual display. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, ellipsoid fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks for its vibrant floral display.
